#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Statusline Script for Claude Code
# Receives JSON via stdin with session data

# Read JSON from stdin
read -r input

# Available data fields:
# - .model: Current AI model (e.g., 'claude-sonnet-4.5')
# - .workspace.path: Current directory path
# - .session.totalTokens: Total tokens used in session
# - .session.estimatedCost: Estimated cost in USD
# - .system.memoryUsage: Memory usage in bytes

# Extract data using jq
model=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.model // "unknown"')
dir=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.workspace.path // "~"' | sed "s|$HOME|~|")
tokens=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.totalTokens // 0')
cost=$(echo "$input" | jq -r '.session.estimatedCost // 0' | awk '{printf "%.3f", $0}')

# ANSI color codes (optional)
RESET="\033[0m"
BLUE="\033[38;5;111m"
ORANGE="\033[38;5;214m"
GREEN="\033[38;5;76m"

# Format and output statusline
echo -e "${BLUE}${model}${RESET} | ${ORANGE}${dir}${RESET} | ${GREEN}${tokens} tokens${RESET} | \$${cost}"
features: Displays current AI model being used
Shows working directory with home shortening
Token count tracking for budget awareness
useCases: Monitor session resource usage during development
Track costs across multiple Claude Code sessions
Quick visual confirmation of current context
Professional appearance for demos and presentations

troubleshooting.issue: Statusline not displaying or showing blank
troubleshooting.solution: Verify script has executable permissions (chmod +x ~/.claude/statusline.sh) and check Claude Code config path is correct in settings.json

troubleshooting.issue: Colors not rendering correctly or showing escape codes
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure your terminal supports ANSI colors. Try setting TERM=xterm-256color environment variable. Test with: echo -e '\033[38;5;111mBlue Text\033[0m'
Install jq JSON processor: macOS: brew install jq | Linux: apt-get install jq or yum install jq | Windows: Download from https://stedolan.github.io/jq/download/
